subject: Re: [junit] Re: Runnable JAR, creating separate main()
msgSnippet: ... If you provide some more details such as what error you are getting (Exception with message and full stacktrace) and also what your test looks like would
messageBody:
Sorry, I was focusing too hard on this part:
> > Exporting the above code creates a 3MB JAR but it does nothing when I
> > click it.

If you provide some more details such as what error you are getting
(Exception with message and full stacktrace) and also what your test looks
like would be helpful.

I think that you are using JUnit3 legacy stuff. I think that you should use
JUnitCore to run your tests:

http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/org/junit/runner/JUnitCore.html

ie JUnitCore.runClasses(TestCase1, TestCase2, ...);

I know this is a bit sketchy but I hope it will give you something to work
with until someone who knows the JUint internals better can provide some
assistance.

/J


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
> >
> > You need a main class and point to the main class in the manifest.
> > If your class has dependencies those need to be listed in the manifests
> > classpath.
> >
> > The first hit on google when you search for runnable jar gives the
> details
> > in a no nonsense form
> >
> > This is not really a JUnit question but more general java.
> >
> > HTH
> > -----------------------------------------------------
> > Blog: johlrogge.wordpress.com
> > Twitter: @johlrogge
> > E-mail: joakim.ohlrogge@...
> >
> >
> > On Tue, Oct 18, 2011 at 12:19 AM, JohnS <keltix@...> wrote:
> >
> > > **
>
> > >
> > >
> > > I'm trying to create a runnable JAR in eclipse using Junit 4.9 but I
> > > can't get it right.
> > >
> > > This website says it is necessary to create a separate class 'main'
> > > http://www.javahotchocolate.com/tutorials/jars-and-wars.html#junit
> > >
> > > I contacted him and he says to try something like this:
> > >
> > > package packege_name;
> > >
> > > import junit.textui.TestRunner;
> > >
> > > public class RunnableTest {
> > > public static void main(String[] args) {
> > >
> > > junit.textui.TestRunner.run(TestCase.class); // separate
> > >
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
> > > But I get an error for 'run'.
> > > Am I forgetting to import something?
> > > Exporting the above code creates a 3MB JAR but it does nothing when I
> > > click it.
> > >
> > > any ideas?
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
>
>
